CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Criminal proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time)
JUDGES: André Potocki;Ann Power-Forde;Dean Spielmann;Elisabet Fura;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mykhaylo Buromenskiy
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE criminal proceedings were instituted into an alleged abuse of authority by officers of the ORG coal mine on account of acquisition of portable telephones for the mine despite the fact that it was badly in arrears with the payment of salaries to its employees .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , the director of the above - mentioned mine at the material time , was officially charged with abuse of authority in connection with the above - mentioned proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was placed under an undertaking not to abscond . Subsequently the applicant was also suspended from his duties as director of the PERSON mine pending the pre - trial criminal investigation of the charges against him .
CARDINAL . On DATE NORP , the mine ’s accountant , was also charged with the abuse of authority within the same proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the pre - trial investigation was completed and on DATE the case was transferred to ORG for trial .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG acquitted the applicant and NORP of the charges of abuse of position in connection with the acquisition of the portable telephones , finding that this action had been taken in the mine ’s interest . CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG office dropped the charges in respect of the alienation of scrap metal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case in respect of the alienation of promissory notes was referred to ORG for a re - trial .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld that decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE , following additional inquiries , the case was transmitted to ORG for a re - trial .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG remitted the case to the prosecutor ’s office for additional investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld that decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE new criminal proceedings were instituted against the applicant on suspicion of forgery of official documents ( that is , the falsification of documents concerning his participation in a fire - prevention training course ) . CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was charged with forgery .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was remitted to ORG for trial .

CARDINAL . On DATE , after several hearings , the court remitted the case to the prosecutor ’s office for additional investigation , referring to numerous shortcomings in the previous investigation and lack of reasoning in the indictment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office terminated the criminal proceedings concerning forgery for want of evidence that the applicant had forged the documents rather than having duly taken part in the training programme . CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG revoked the ruling of DATE by which criminal proceedings had been instituted against the applicant on suspicion of forgery , having found that it had been made without a sufficient legal basis . CARDINAL . On DATE the court decided to leave the applicant ’s claim without consideration on account of his failure to appear at the hearing .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court invalidated the disputed suspension order as unlawful .
CARDINAL . According to the case - file materials , that decision was not appealed against .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of DATE following the defendant ’s appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE rejected the defendant ’s request for leave to appeal in cassation .

DATE . On DATE ORG allowed the applicant ’s claim in part .
